Key Arguments: The proposed legislation threatens free speech in Australia.
Terms like 'misinformation' and 'disinformation' are open to broad interpretation, making the bill potentially dangerous.
The government has previously censored factual information during the Covid-19 pandemic, which raises concerns about future censorship under the new bill.
The legislation contradicts Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, which protects freedom of opinion and expression.
The bill is seen as a step towards totalitarianism, which the author believes will be opposed by divine intervention and civil disobedience.
Main Themes: Human rights and freedom of expression
Historical context of government censorship during Covid-19
Notable Quotes: The proposed Bill carries with it the destruction of free speech in Australia should it ever be passed.
The government is trying to justify suppressing free speech on social media on the pretext of stopping 'misinformation' and 'disinformation' that is 'harmful'.
When governments contrive pretexts to limit speech, they are lurching down the dangerous path to totalitarianism.
The more government leans toward totalitarianism the more God will work against it.
